titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1828 Nov. 6 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1828 Nov. 6
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This is an excerpt from Thursday November 6, 1828, on which dated a case involving debt was heard before the court. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: The Court according to adjournment. Present The Judges A. Ross. J. Huss and W. S. Adair.

Thomas Pettit &
David Vann
vs
John Downing
Executor of George Downing decd.
On a plea of Debt, arising from Copartership in trade amounting to $4271.00
The Court finds for the Defendant

row.cell: Mary Alberty 5 days at hickory Log

p.add:
deturo? to Eli Harlin
Execution issued
13th Decr_ 1828
